Articles.Content:
I have recently attempted to install Real Solar System for my game to give me a new challenge, but I have encountered a few problems in doing so. Using CKAN, I found and downloaded Real Solar System along with Realism Overhaul, doing so I also installed all the necessary dependencies for each mod. The game starts just fine, and loads with normal speed until I get to one part, pictured here: https://imgur.com/gallery/kv0Q0Ci. As you can see, the game is stuck loading Squad/Parts/Engine/jetEngine/jetEngineAfterburning/turbojet, and to me it seems to be a stock part (though I have just surmised this). I have tried copying my Steam game file and downloading RSS and RO, but to no avail as the same problem occurred. I have also tried solely installing Realism Overhaul, and my game worked just fine, and loaded into the main menu. However when I have only Real Solar System installed, this happens to my game. If there are any experts who can be so kind to help pin down this problem and get this mod to run, I will be able to provide most or any needed information, 

Sincerely,

A Kerbonaut in Peril

 

(Image of loading screen)

P.S, my game is not completely frozen, only my loading bar, the background image still rotates and I can move my mouse

Most likely an error with that part has caused the game to stop loading, but we'll need the log files to be sure. Here's where to look:

What version of KSP are you using? If it was a modded part, I'd suggest removing that part and trying again, but a stock Squad-made part shouldn't cause that; you might have a corrupted copy of KSP, so try redownloading it or verifying the game files through Steam if you got it there.

Also- don't try RSS/RO/RP-1 on KSP 1.11. Just don't. I did, so now I tell everyone else not to- it's more hassle than it's worth; stick to 1.10 especially since RSS, RO and RP-1 all got updated to fully work with KSP 1.10 a couple of weeks ago.

On 4/10/2021 at 8:03 AM, jimmymcgoochie said:

Most likely an error with that part has caused the game to stop loading, but we'll need the log files to be sure. Here's where to look:

What version of KSP are you using? If it was a modded part, I'd suggest removing that part and trying again, but a stock Squad-made part shouldn't cause that; you might have a corrupted copy of KSP, so try redownloading it or verifying the game files through Steam if you got it there.

Also- don't try RSS/RO/RP-1 on KSP 1.11. Just don't. I did, so now I tell everyone else not to- it's more hassle than it's worth; stick to 1.10 especially since RSS, RO and RP-1 all got updated to fully work with KSP 1.10 a couple of weeks ago.

Sorry for such the long delay! I took your advice once again and installed a copy of 1.10.1 and my game is working like butter. All of my mods have been successfully installed and I have been playing with no problems at all! Thanks again!
